result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward J Stencil was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week.

SAFE Program
Assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the department.
Court notes if defendant successfully completes terms of probation it will entertain early discharge. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: Jail on count 2 only.  Jail is IMPOSED & STAYED for rule violations and after court approval.  Court finds defendant is not entitled to any jail credit in this file.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: Same as count 2 in this file.

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief  (includes 14CF508, filed in 14CF511)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:04 am 
INCLUDES 14CF508 AND 14CF511. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Def appears in person with Atty Bill Mansell.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to:
In 14CF508: Ct. 1 (Strangulation and Suffocation/DA)>>D&RI. 
In 14CF511: Ct. 1 (Felony BJ)>>AMEND to Misd. BJ pursuant to 946.49(1)(a). 
                    : Ct. 2 (Felony BJ)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 14CF508: Ct. 2 (Misd. Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 14CF511: Amended Ct. 1 (Misd. BJ)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
B.W. makes statement. Atty Mansell makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS ON ALL: SAFE program; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; payment of court costs including to 2 DA surcharges.
                                                                          - CONDITION OF PROBATION on Ct. 2 in 14CF508 ONLY: 90 days MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations and after court approval.  
COURT notes if def successfully completes terms of probation it will entertain early discharge. 
COURT finds def is entitled to NO days credit in 14CF508 and 1 day jail credit in 14CF511. 
Adj: 9:27 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 16, 2014 at 09:50 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Pre-trial conference on September 3, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 11:18 am 
INCLUDES 14CF508 AND 14CF511. 
State appears by ADA Lesli Pluster; Deft appears in person with Atty Bill Mansell. 

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARINGS IN BOTH FILES. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver.
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made.
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial.  
Informations filed. Reading Waived.
Plea: Not Guilty to all. 
COURT advises parties to see JA to schedule future dates. 
Bond Continues.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.   No contact with victim(s): B.A. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. MCSD police escort to retrieve any personal belongings.
